author: DarwinJS
body:
The Get-Help on Linux Depends on "less" command - this is an Amazon Linux 2 container (which - as provided by AWS - has a completely minimalized package footprint) and I get this error:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/11597190/58968131-826a9780-8783-11e9-9a8e-458b6c99c381.png)

This raises the questions:
- is there a managed list of what PowerShell core assumes is on the system?
- shouldn't the packages for PowerShell Core check for and resolve these dependencies if system commands depend on them?
- or should it just not depend on any OS packages?

Apologies if this is covered somewhere - if so, please drop a link in this issue :)

comments.author: vexx32
comments.body:
I have raised a concern related specifically to the availability of `less`/`more` here before: #7851

FWIW it's not `Get-Help` that has this dependency; it's the `help` function, which is actually a function and not a true alias. `Get-Help` on its own normally does not provide paging.

I'm of the opinion that PS should _not_ be dependent on any OS-specific packages that it is not itself providing in the installation.

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body: /cc @SteveL-MSFT for any conclusion. Should we fix the dependency? Should we document dependencies?

comments.author: SteveL-MSFT
comments.body: It seems we can resolve this by checking if `less` is available before using it, otherwise, just don't page.

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body: It seems we already check if `less` or another pager present.
